intro: Erigeron fernandezianus, commonly known as the Fernandez's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine regions. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to the harsh conditions of its natural habitat.
